meanings.sent1: The triviality of the situation made it easy to overlook.
meanings.sent2: She dismissed the triviality of the argument and focused on more pressing matters.
meanings.sent3: The triviality of the missing sock became a running joke in the household.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of things, the triviality of his mistake was quickly forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the triviality of punctuation errors in comparison to content clarity.

meanings.definition: Something that is of little value or importance
meanings.sent1: He collected various trivialities like bottle caps and buttons.
meanings.sent2: The shop sold cheap trivialities that no one really needed.
meanings.sent3: The triviality of the souvenir keychain made it a perfect gift for the tourist.
meanings.sent4: Her room was cluttered with trivialities that held sentimental value to her alone.
meanings.sent5: The box contained a mix of trivialities and treasures, each with its own story.
